message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.DS 

This paper deals with machine learning algorithms and their susceptibility to data poisoning attacks, which are common topics in the sub-fields of machine learning (cs.LG), computer security and cryptography (cs.CR), computer vision (cs.CV), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The paper proposes a strategy to build linear classifiers that are certifiably robust against a strong variant of label-flipping, which is a problem that is relevant to all of these sub-fields. Therefore, it is likely that this paper could be classified under any of these sub-categories, with cs.LG and cs.CR being the most likely due to the focus on machine learning and security.
